storyInfo: Having saved the Doctor and Amiya, Logos's group encounter a mirage of their own. Logos finds the Convallis of the Banshees within, and recalls his oath to his mother as he became Lord of the Banshees. The group come across a logistical squad headed by Paprika, and commander its vehicle.

attributes.text: The fog grows thicker. The entire forest seems to swim in it.

I'll confess, I'm not so familiar with Kazdel at all. By the end of the Banshee's Court's part in the war two hundred years ago, I was gone from that city. It was in the Convallis of the Banshees I came of age.
I had asked my mother why, being one of our 'Six Heroes', she would choose to leave Kazdel, the city she once fought to the bitter end for.
\nMy mother issued no response at the time; she plucked a few reeds from the riverbank, and wove a necklace for me. Their stems twisted about each other, head to tail, tail to head.
It was beautiful, and I treasured it in the most genuine sense. Yet very soon, it withered and faded, and fell to scattered pieces.
\nMy mother told me how this was the Banshees' most traditional artform. We weave song and incantation, just as we weave necklaces of grass.
But now, we had the entire Convallis.
\nThey needed not be foraged, needed not be bothered, and so year after year, they grew forever.
We Banshees sang our elegies, but the elegies were no supplication of the end; rather, they were anticipation of new life.
\nThere is the Sarkaz's need—not to hold a dead city standing, but to grow.

attributes.content: This is a highly disconcerting environment, Doctor. We were in the thick of a forest only moments ago.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: What laid before us became nothing alike as the fog settled in.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A... convallis.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Is this all an illusion, Logos?

attributes.text: The Doctor is considerably wounded, but their tone of voice is steadied once more.
Ascalon silently carries the still-unconscious Amiya, taking the very front.
\nShe remains as ever, lips sealed. But I can sense that her current silence is a more... bleak one than before.
\nI remember, at the time of her hurried rendezvous with me, that flicker of an expression I found hard to discern.

attributes.content: Mirages are spin from nothingness. Their scenes are mere fictions in the mind, bound to return to nihil no matter how lifelike.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But this place is not.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Everything here truly did exist, once upon a time.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Constructing a 'mirage' like this requires not just intelligence and information, but time, and space.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It's too difficult.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A bone whistle?

attributes.text: I know this Convallis.
\nI've always loved it.

attributes.content: Yes, the whistle of the Banshees. It doesn't necessarily entail Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: When we were young, we'd learn it by the riverside. We'd sit among the underbrush, and wait still. Until great fin gobbled small bug, until fowlbeast snatched up great fin.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: That is when the bone whistle is played.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: What's this scenery doing here? How do we get out?
I'm trying.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Originium Arts hasn't this power. The power this is of can only be something more ancient.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But it shouldn't come about in this battlefield at this moment, not on Londinium's periphery.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Everything we're seeing and hearing could pass for real. Our squad is not in good condition. We need to up our vigilance.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.text: At the Convallis's other end, there seems to stand someone, dead still, silent.

attributes.content: ...Mother.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Logos, what's wrong?
...Nothing.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I say try to tear this landscape apart directly. It carries some risk, but it's the best solution.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I don't know whether it'd be safe to leave this place, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: Ascalon nods, handing Amiya over to the Doctor, who strains to hold her up by the arm that isn't hurt.
Ascalon, master assassin, vanishes in a blink into the mist.
\nI shut my eyes and prepare, conceiving of destruction, imagining reconstruction.
But the figure appears again, this time atop one of the Convallis's crests. She seems to be looking at me, but she is as if a thin slice of the past, stuck frozen in some older time.
\nI know that crest full well. When I was young, I would practice incanting there, until twilight fell, and she would show up behind me.
\nI would never know when exactly she had come, but she would just stand there, as she does now in this mirage.
\nAnd once I exhausted myself, we would go home together.
I feel for my bone whistle. It's cold as bale ice. Just like the time I was first given it.
\nNot long ago, I sounded it to the closure of Damazti's Court.
\nBut the time before that, that was back in this Convallis.

attributes.content: I'll be leaving tomorrow, for Babel.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: You're master of the Elegiac Court now. Remember to send Her Highness Theresa my greetings.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: It still doesn't feel real to me, Mother.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I'm too young to be master of a Royal Court.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Now, now, what makes you say that? Anyone could see how remarkable you are.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Keep this safe.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Oh…
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Your bone whistle. I've tuned it for you, and given it a Royal Court crest.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: And of course, a kiss full of magic too.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Simply sound it, and all the Sarkaz will know it as the will of the Knell.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Mother, what should a Lord of the Banshees do?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Do what you believe you must.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: I once talked to you about those... ravings of mine.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The fettered Sarkaz have no escape, just as the necklaces you used to weave together for me became naught but pieces in the end.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Yet what fetters us is our identity, to what we belong.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The 'Royal Court', and perhaps, 'The King of Sarkaz'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But still you bestow this aspect on me.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Our rotting bones will never again be given new life, should annihilation reach its destination.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: And yet... that is the rule.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: We sound the Knell for all, for others, for ourselves.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: But it is a necessary burden.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: If you feel our timeworn inheritance has been reduced to naught but a stepping stone to new life, then it is for you to ascertain that yourself.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Supposing that does not change your mind—
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: —then 'from death comes new life'.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.text: I rest the whistle to my lips.

attributes.content: ...*exhale*.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: My, my, now, well done.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Oh tender little Lord of the Banshees, for whom does your first fledgling Knell toll?
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: ...For myself.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: For the Royal Court that would rot, past and future all.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: The Sarkaz must write a new verse.

attributes.content: 'What meaning is there in a stagnant landscape?'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: With the words, power bursts forth.

attributes.content: This is…
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The Vampire's witchcraft.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But the Vampire could never construct the landscape we were just in. I fear there's some other presence helping him.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: What is the Vampire planning to do with these Arts Circles?

attributes.text: Laboring to keep Amiya supported, the Doctor lifts their head with some worry, taking in the giant, sanguine-colored crystals.

attributes.content: The loop here isn't even complete. But... some of its symbols are legible.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: 'PURIFY'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It's trying to affect our blood somehow. Affect Sarkaz blood.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This Artistry... is tied to the Sarkaz's power.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: The Doctor gives no response, seemingly lost in thought.

attributes.content: Hey!

attributes.text: Heh, they finally ran out of patience.
\nI detected them long ago; a handful of boorish wanderers. The derangement of our spacetime was masking their figures, and now, with the mist abated, they finally show themselves.
Already, the silver glint in Ascalon's hand has cut across their necks, while bone-writ incantation blocks their attack.
A clump of dirt? It's crude as a child would be.

attributes.content: Wait!
I told you they were real!
Those ghosts were the real deal!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.text: Ah, it is a child.

attributes.content: Is that you...?

attributes.text: Does the Doctor know this Sarkaz girl?

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You're that, uh, 'Doctor', right? I saw you once in the munitions factory in Highbury!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: And the knocked-out Cautus, and... Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You were supplying goods to refugees in Norport.
How did you know that?!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Don't—Don't let it slip! I was just, uhh—
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I don't think that Cautus girl is looking too good, is she? And your arm is all...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I, um, I'm gonna guess you guys are... fine hanging out with these Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I think we ended up back where we came. But did we do it for real this time?
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: I've met enough haloed monster things for one day. This is out of whack.
attributes.name: Fierce Sarkaz

attributes.content: Paprika, what are you talking to the ghosts for?
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: One... in a hood, one unconscious bunny, and a Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Fierce Sarkaz

attributes.content: No! Driver, they're real!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: As in real?
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.text: This Sarkaz steps up to me, skeptically looking me up and down.
\nI can tell with a glance that she's never taken the battlefield. Her hands are callused in the wrong places.
\nJust now, did the young Paprika girl call her Driver?

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Blaagh!
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.content: Miner, come check this out, it's real!
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.content: Your... your clothes must've cost some money, didn't they?
attributes.name: 'Miner'

attributes.content: Maybe take a closer look! No, never mind, trust you Ursus bumpkins not to know.
attributes.name: Astute Sarkaz

attributes.content: Quit it with the 'ooh I'm from Kazdel' already, Shopkeep, like you matter! All you do there is run a grocery store!
attributes.name: 'Miner'

attributes.content: Oh, wait, forgot, you sold your store so you come pick fights out here! Ha!
attributes.name: 'Miner'

attributes.content: Shape UP a little! Stop getting carried away in front of people!
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.content: Hello, hahah... you may have met me in Kazdel before. My grocery store was a fairly popular one...
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.text: The man nicknamed Shopkeep rubs his hands, eyeing me with ingratiation.
\nHis dagger is equipped with an auxiliary Originium Arts control apparatus; never an affordable piece of kit. A shame it's all-new, dagger itself included.

attributes.content: You... must be part of the Royal Court, yes? I can tell by your regalia... I take it you're the—Child of Soil and Stone?
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.text: \nSo he hasn't the first clue about any Court at all.

attributes.content: ...I am the Banshee.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A boy Banshee? I thought Banshees were meant to be all girls?
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Huh. Never heard about any boy Banshee while I was in Kazimierz... uh, not that I mean to be impolite or, you know...
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.content: Paprika, you're friends with celebrities like him and you never told us?!
attributes.name: 'Driver'

attributes.content: Uh... no, I dunno if we know each other...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Are you moving things?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: Inside their truck, I notice an uncovered spot, where a few blood-streaked crystals are poking out.

attributes.content: Where are you transporting these goods to? Aren't these ritual materials?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Er... I don't really know how to explain. We're just patrolling along our route map, 'cause some Arts Circles might be a little damaged, and we need to repair them.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.text: The Doctor makes brief eye contact with me. I have some inkling. A Sarkaz truck—a vehicle that can take us through the battlefield.
\nWith Amiya's current condition, we won't be rendezvousing with the main unit on foot.
\nI can sense Ascalon all set to go in the shadows, ready to strike at the amateur squad before us.
\nBut evidently, the Doctor already has a better idea.

attributes.content: Noble Banshee, sire, we won't cross the battlefield alive at this rate. I beg you, just let us go.

attributes.text: I can comprehend the Doctor's gist, but... I'm really not well-versed when it comes to this.

attributes.content: I commandeer your transport squadron. We are on a special mission of the utmost nature, but were assailed en route. For your assistance, I will memorialize you forevermore.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Haha, it'd be our honor to serve a member of the Royal Court, Your Highness!
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.content: It's just... being 'memorialized' by a death-tolling Banshee... doesn't seem like much of a fortune. Could you...
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.content: Here is your payment.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: Thank you, coins that Mechanist stuffed in my bag.

attributes.content: Haha! Thank you, sire!
attributes.name: 'Shopkeep'

attributes.content: But our transport duty...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I'll explain to your superiors afterwards.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A special mission? Why bring these two outbloods along?
attributes.name: 'Miner'

attributes.content: ...They are my captives.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Captives? But you, um...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Okay... but once this is over, you guys are gonna come see General Manfred with me.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: For now, we'll go sort out some positions.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.text: The Doctor comes to my side, voice grave.

attributes.content: Logos, figure out a car for Ascalon too.
The Confessarii attack was no simple one. They and the Vampire were working together, but in the process, they estranged Amiya from the ship.
Doctor, are you worrying?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Closure and the Self-Salvation Corps troops don't have any suitable combat personnel between them. Kal'tsit's wounded. Shining's powerful, but the Confessarii are sure to have methods prepared just for her.
...I understand.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The state Amiya's in may not be curable with medication. What she needs most right now, before she comes to, is not to fall into the Confessarii's line of sight.
Operating under this squad's support will be safer.
I'll get Ascalon to back up Kal'tsit. We've got you here.
Besides...

attributes.text: The Doctor looks at the sanguine Arts Circles. A pit forms in their stomach.
\nSay no more. I know far too well.

attributes.content: These crystals... aren't just simple Originium.
attributes.name: Logos
